name: Flowering Cauliflower Stir-Fry
description: This is my basic vegetable stir-fry so when you can't find flowering cauliflower, feel free to try this recipe with green beans, gailan (Chinese broccoli), broccolini, or asparagus. If the vegetable is on the biggish side, parboil it briefly to move cooking along.
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 to 2 tablespoons neutral oil (such as canola)
Fine sea salt or kosher salt
1/3 cup water or lightly salted chicken broth (plus more as needed)
1 teaspoon sesame or unrefined peanut oil

recipeInstructions.text: Slice off a bit from the dry stem ends, then separate the cauliflower into slender, chopstickable pieces. If some are too long to be bite size, cut some of the stem but keep them to stir-fry! If there are tough seeming stem parts (bite one to see), cut off the tough outer skin. You should net about 1 1/4 pounds, or roughly 4 cups.
recipeInstructions.name: Slice off a bit from the dry stem ends, then separate the cauliflower into slender, chopstickable pieces. If some are too long to be bite size, cut some of the stem but keep them to stir-fry! If there are tough seeming stem parts (bite one to see), cut off the tough outer skin. You should net about 1 1/4 pounds, or roughly 4 cups.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a large wok or skillet over high heat. Add the oil and swirl to coat. When shimmering and hot, add the flowering cauliflower and sprinkle in salt to season. Stir and flip with enthusiasm for 1 to 2 minutes, until glossy and glowing.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat a large wok or skillet over high heat. Add the oil and swirl to coat. When shimmering and hot, add the flowering cauliflower and sprinkle in salt to season. Stir and flip with enthusiasm for 1 to 2 minutes, until glossy and glowing.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour in the water, stir, then cover. Lower the heat slightly and cook for about 3 minutes, uncovering and stirring occasionally. When the cauliflower is just tender crisp, uncover. If there is water left in the pan, allow it to vigorously boil off. If there’s no water left and the cauliflower is firm, add a splash of water and replace the lid.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour in the water, stir, then cover. Lower the heat slightly and cook for about 3 minutes, uncovering and stirring occasionally. When the cauliflower is just tender crisp, uncover. If there is water left in the pan, allow it to vigorously boil off. If there’s no water left and the cauliflower is firm, add a splash of water and replace the lid.

recipeInstructions.text: When you’re satisfied with the cauliflower’s doneness, pour in the sesame oil and stir to combine. Turn off the heat. Taste and add extra salt as needed. Transfer to a plate and serve.
recipeInstructions.name: When you’re satisfied with the cauliflower’s doneness, pour in the sesame oil and stir to combine. Turn off the heat. Taste and add extra salt as needed. Transfer to a plate and serve.
